question.title: What is the purpose of radiography in the diagnosis of microcrystalline arthropathies?
question.description: The radiographic examination of the pelvis to identify calcifications of the pubic symphysis and femoral cartilages

option_a.title: To diagnose osteoarthritis
option_a.description: A common condition characterized by the breakdown of joint cartilage

option_b.title: To evaluate the alignment of the pelvis
option_b.description: A critical aspect of assessing joint health and movement

option_c.title: To detect calcifications of the pubic symphysis and femoral cartilages
option_c.description: A specific type of joint abnormality characteristic of microcrystalline arthropathies

option_d.title: To rule out other joint disorders
option_d.description: A general approach to assessing joint health and detecting potential issues

correct_option.title: c
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
